c74object.name: orchidea.solution.toroll
c74object.digest: Import orchidea solutions into a bach.roll
c74object.description: Receives the output of orchidea.solve and fills a given bach.roll object with the global connection or with a set of orchidea solutions.

inlet.description: The first inlet receives the solution information coming from orchidea.solve's first outlet.

Second inlet receives a list containing either a single number (the segment whose solutions should be displayed; 0 = global connection, default), or two numbers (the segment number and the solution number), or a bach range syntax (see list).

outlet.description: The outlet outputs the specified solution(s) in bach.roll's llll form

objarg.name: segmentnumber
objarg.description: The optional first argument sets the segment number.

objarg.name: solutionnumber
objarg.description: The optional second argument sets the solution number.

method.name: list/llll
method.digest: Import solution to buffer or set which solutions are to be imported
method.description:
Left inlet should be connected to the leftmost output of a orchidea.solve object, that will send the need information about all the solutions (prefix, number of segments and number of solutions for each segment).
Right inlet expects either 0 (meaning: import the connection), or a single number N (meaning: import all solutions for the N-th segment), or two numbers: a segment number and a solution number (in order to import a single solution).
The bach range syntax is also supported; e.g. use 3 (4 5 7) to import solutions 4, 5 and 7 for segment 3; use 3 ((5 10)) to import solutions 5 through 10 for the same segment.

c74object.discussion: This module only work if the bach library is installed (www.bachproject.net).

entry.name: Inlet 1 (list)
entry.description: Solution information. The first inlet receives the solution information coming from orchidea.solve's first outlet.

entry.name: Inlet 2 (int/list/llll)
entry.description: Segment and solution indices. Second inlet receives a list containing either a single number (the segment whose solutions should be displayed; 0 = global connection, default), or two numbers (the segment number and the solution number), or a bach range syntax (see list).

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: Solution(s) in bach.roll form. The outlet outputs the specified solution(s) in bach.roll's llll form

entry.name: More details
entry.description: This module only work if the bach library is installed (www.bachproject.net).
